categores.title: Assessments
categores.summary: Assessments for dyslexia and other specific learning difficulties.

categores.title: Early Years
categores.summary: Services for early years children (0-5 years).

categores.title: Post 16 and Adults
categores.summary: Services for post 16 students and adults.

categores.title: Specialist Teaching
categores.summary: Specialist teaching for children and young people with additional needs.

categores.title: Training and Development
categores.summary: Training and development for staff, parents and carers.

services.title: Access Arrangements Testing
services.summary: Formal assessment of students who may require additional support during exams due to specific learning difficulties or disabilities. £60 per pupil.
details: Completion of Part 1 of Form 8 is required prior to the assessment
A thorough evaluation of the student's needs.
Completion of Part 2 of Form 8 by assessor.

services.title: Adult Support
services.summary: Support for individuals studying at a higher level or in the workplace. £60 per hour or 6 hours block booked at £300.
details: Areas of targeted support agreed beforehand such as; study skills, organisation, and planning time.
Emotional and mental wellbeing support available through the sessions and where it arises.

services.title: Bespoke Speech and Language Support
services.summary: Training and/or consultation for speech and language needs. £100 per hour or £530 for a 6 hour block.
details: Speech and language screenings
Bespoke support focused on the setting priorities (e.g. staff training in Word Aware Vocabulary or Colourful Semantics)
SENCo consultation and planning support
1:1 demonstrations and in-class modelling of strategies
Assessment led therapy (without a full written report), where appropriate

services.title: Bespoke Teaching Packages for EOTAS Pupils
services.details: Please contact Becky Johnson for further information at becky@newts.uk.
services.summary: 1:1 and small group provision for EOTAS pupils. Price available on request.

services.title: Development Training
services.summary: Staff training via Zoom or in person with Ellie. £150 per hour.
details: Range of SEND and development related subjects.

services.title: Developmental Interventions
services.summary: Tailored developmental interventions carried out 1:1 as a half day. £150.
details: Initial in person assessment and discussion with staff/family
Block of planned developmental play sessions
End of unit report

services.title: Early Years Development Play Assessment
services.summary: Early years development assessment lasting 4-5 hrs. £230.
details: Discussion with family or setting staff, and observation time if at an Early Years setting
In person play and interaction based assessment
Mid length report, feedback and advice

services.title: Family and School Support
services.summary: Guidance and recommendations for families and school staff.
details: Sometimes support can come in the form of guidance and recommendations to the family/carers and staff supporting the individual in their journey.
Some examples include study skills, home routines to help improve home-life, and training in specific areas of need.

services.title: Foundation Stage Project
services.summary: Foundation stage project reception year. 13-14 hours. £700.
details: Meeting with staff to plan via zoom
Two mornings on site with staff carrying out whole cohort play based assessment
Detailed long report
Follow up meeting to support planning for cohort development key needs
Two twilight trainings on topics related to key needs

services.title: Full Developmental Assessment
services.summary: A full developmental assessment for year 1 onwards. 5-6 hour assessment with a detailed report. £270.
details: Preliminary conversation with family and/or school staff
In person developmental assessment
Long written report, feedback and advice

services.title: Full Diagnostic Dyslexia Assessment
services.summary: A face-to-face assessment followed by a substantial written report. Age 8 to end of year 11 £525, age 16+ £550.
details: Approximately 3 hours, this can only be completed on individuals age 8 and over.
Assessment consists of standardised assessments which reflect strengths and challenges across underlying ability and cognitive processing abilities.
Assessment of attainment in the areas of reading, spelling, and writing.
Detailed diagnostic written report, including recommendations and any considerations for exam access arrangements.
This report will travel with the individual for life as I hold an APC.
For 18 years + we are able to identify characteristics of ADHD as part of a full diagnostic assessment. This involves an additional 2-hour interview at a cost of £120.

services.title: Full Speech and Language Assessment
services.summary: A full speech and language assessment for children and adults lasting up to 6 hours. £370.
details: An initial discussion with parents/carers and school staff
Liaison with relevant professionals, if appropriate
A comprehensive assessment of speech, language and communication skills
Observations of communcation in everyday activities and play
Interpretation of assessment findings
A clear, detailed written report
Feeback with practical, personalised recommendations

services.title: Pupil Observation
services.summary: In class pupil focused observation. £60.
details: Focus to be decided prior to observation.
Up to one hour observation in class.
Includes verbal feedback.
Optionally, written feedback can be provided for an additional charge.

services.title: Resilience Coaching
services.summary: Curriculum led education and wellness experience for 9- to 18-year-olds with Steph.
details: In small groups or 1:1, children and adolescents aged 9 to 18 will learn through experiential activities, videos, games and dynamic exercises, which take place over 11 interactive sessions.
Resilience coaching will empower your child to deal with issues such as self-esteem and labels, using social media, hostile behaviour of others, and disagreements and conflicts.
The Resilience Tutoring package includes the Creating a Resilient Family course for parents.
Resilience and wellbeing training gives your child the confidence to manage feelings and overcome difficulties.
Past participants have reported less anxiety, worry, fear and reactive behaviour and improved relationships with parents, siblings and peers.

services.title: Small Group SEND Observation
services.summary: Observation and advice for small group of early years children with SEND and developmental needs. 2.5-3 hour session. £150 per child.
details: Observation, discussion with staff and play with identified children at setting with parental permission
Verbal advice
Short report and suggested next steps and activities

services.title: Small Space for Hire
services.summary: Please get in touch if you are looking for a space for individual talking therapies or for groups of up to 8 people. Price available on request.
details: We have a small space available for hire in Strixton, Northamptonshire.
Suitable for individual talking therapies or small groups of up to 8 people.
Price available on request.

services.title: Spotlight Assessment
services.summary: A face-to-face assessment followed by a short report. NB This assessment will not diagnose dyslexia. £300.
details: Approximately 1.5 hours, this can be completed on children from age 6+

Bespoke Spotlight will cover standardised test of underlying ability and one further area of cognitive processing; such as phonological processing or working memory. A word reading and word spelling test will also be administered.
Detailed short written report, including recommendations.
Can be accompanied by a pupil focussed observation in class, for an additional fee.

services.title: Training
services.summary: Bespoke training can be arranged on request. Usually we cover executive function skills, dyslexia and neurodiversity.
details: Schools. In school training for SENCOs, Teachers or Teaching Assistants.
Parents. Online or small face-to-face group training available.

services.title: Specialist Teaching for Children with SEND
services.summary: 1:1 and small group specialist teaching for children with SEND. £60 per hour or £300 for a block of 6 hours.
details: Some individuals may benefit from specialist teaching to support their learning and development. This can be delivered at the Strixton centre.
Specialist teaching can focus on areas such as literacy, numeracy, executive function skills, social skills, and emotional regulation.
Sessions are tailored to the individual's needs and learning style.
Progress is regularly reviewed and feedback is provided to parents and carers.
Six week blocks are available at a discounted rate.

services.title: Workplace Needs Assessments
services.summary: Specialist evaluation of the employees' working environment, and tasks to identify adjustments needed. These assessments help employers fulfil their legal obligations under The Equality Act 2010, and promote a more inclusive and productive workplace. £540.
details: The primary goal is to identify reasonable adjustments, accommodations, or assistive technologies that enable the employee to perform their job duties effective and safely.
Suitable for individuals with a range of neurodiverse conditions.
Involves conducting a 1:1 interview with the employee and employer.
The assessment results in a report with detailed recommendations for adjustments tailored to the individual's needs and workplace context.
